fields.description:
h3. Summary
Fonts on the drop-down menu are blurry when the ratio of zoom-in on browsers goes above 100%.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set the zoom ratio for the browse at 100%
# Go to any board in any project and click to display the drop-down menu, for example, Quick Filters, the font will look fine
# Decrease the zoom ratio to 90%.
# Open the Quick Filter again and the font will be blurry

h3. Expected Results
Fonts should remain the same format as with when using a ratio of 100%.

h3. Actual Results
Fonts become blurry as below.
https://cl.ly/21990cf6746d

h3.Workaround
None.
fields.summary: Drop-down menu fonts becomes blurry when zoom-in ratio on browser increases.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new issue view, when I click on a subtask, my back button no longer works because the URL of the browser is not being changed to the subtask any longer.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access to a cloud instance that is already with the new issue experience for the full view
# add a subtask to the Jira issue 
# Try accessing the subtask

h3. Expected Results
* The URL gets updated with the value of the subtask issue key

h3. Actual Results
* The URL remains with the parent issue key. 
 
h3. Notes
Check this short video for better understanding of the use case:  [^Recording #230.mp4] 
h3.Workaround
The workaround is shown in the video, basically ensure to click above the subtask issue key to get redirected correctly.
fields.summary: In the new issue view, when clicking to access the subtask from the parent, the URL is not redirected correctly

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing an issue in the new issue view, the fields that show up are not sorted in the order that is presented in the screen that is being applied to the issue.

In the old issue view, fields would be sorted in screen order. For fields that were in the right-hand side section (like dates and user-pickers) those would be sorted, then grouped by field type such that sorting would only be local to field types.

Neither of these sorting schemes are followed by the new issue view.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a number of test custom fields to your instance of various types. The issue shows best with dates and user-pickers
# Create a screen and carefully set the order of the custom fields as desired
# Observe a ticket in the new issue view.
# (Optional) Change the order of the custom fields and observe the order in the New issue View.

h3. Expected Results
The order of the fields on the screen will be reflected in the order shown on the issue view.

h3. Actual Results
The fields will not follow the sorting that was set in the screen. The order will not change if you change the order on the screen
 
h3. Notes
N/a

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: New Issue View does not support Screen sort order

fields.description:
If you use the JQL Priority = X, the JQL will returns issues where the field ID = X of the field value = X.

For example.

Let's say you have two Priority fields.

Priority Field 1
 Field id: 4
 Field value: 2

Priority Field 2
 Field id: 3
 Field Value 4

If you run Priority = 4, it will return issues from both fields, the first field because the the field id = 4, the second field because the field value = 4.
h3. Workaround

Define field values as non numeric, e.g. for priority defined allowed values as {{P1}}, {{P2}}, {{P3}} rather than {{1}}, {{2}}, {{3}}, so JQL search phrase like {{Priority="P3"}} would bring expected results only.
fields.summary: JQL Priority = X is broken, it returns issues from the the priority field id = X or priority field value = X.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users can create dashboards and/or filters that are publically accessible.
h3. Suggested Solution

To give *site-admins* the option to receive email notifications when a user creates either a public dashboard or a public filter.
h3. Why this is important

Some *site-admins* would prefer that their instances do not have any public filters or dashboards. By giving them an email alert, the *site-admin* can make adjustments to the dashboard or filters making them private.
h3.
fields.summary: Have the ability to receive email notifications when a public dashboard / public filter is created

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Jira Settings > Issues > Statuses, a user is able to move a status up/down to order where it should be displayed when trying to perform a transition. But this is not reflected for the Quick Issue View when viewing issue from the board.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *Statuses* (Settings > Issues > Statuses)
# Order the statuses according to your liking
# Navigate to any issues that have most or all of the statuses via the browse link: https://INSTANCE_NAME.atlassian.net/browser/TEST-1
# If there are a few statuses, click on *Workflow* and the statuses are ordered properly based on the 2nd step.
# Then, have a board that contains this issue. 
# Click on the issue from the board, the quick issue view will pop up
# Try to transition by clicking on the status: The statuses are ordered based on *Status Category*(To Do, In Progress, Done), then *alphabetical order*.

h3. Expected Results
* Quick Issue View should display the statuses similarly to how it is displayed on the browse issue link.

h3. Actual Results
* Quick Issue View is ordering the statuses based on *Status Category*, then *alphabetical order*.
fields.summary: Inconsistent status order in Quick Issue View from a board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

From the desktop client, Jira users can post URL as plain text like as below:
{code:none}
http://example.com/
{code}
From the mobile app, URLs will be automatically converted into link notation:
{code:none}
[http://example.com/|http://example.com/]
{code}
When Jira users try to edit the URL in the comment on the mobile, it is trouble to edit the URL if the URL is converted in link notation.
 Since the URLs will render as a link even with plain text, there's no advantage to converting the URL into link notation.
h3. Suggested Solution

Do not convert the URL to link notation and keep the URL as plain text.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Ability to post URL without link notation on mobile
Internal Error 500 on update of Parent Link via REST API /issue

fields.description: While performing a CSV import as a user, the option available during field mapping is a lot less (restricted) compared to the options available to Admins. Having the non-admin CSV importer mirror the same functionalities as the Admin CSV importer would be a useful functionality that allows users to map issues properly during import.
fields.summary: Non admin CSV importer has limited field mapping options.

fields.description:
It would be handy to be able to change assignee of an issue based on certain workflow conditions. For instance, if the current assignee is either person 'A or B' and issue reaches a status 'S', the assignee should be changed to person 'C'.

A possible use case can be, if the person moving the issue to *IN Development* status, is in a certain group with authority, issue assignee should be changed to a *Developer*, otherwise, it should not.
fields.summary: Ability to change assignee conditionally

fields.description:
h3. Description

Most of the times uploading large CSV files to the "external csv importer" feature can fail. When this happens, the user faces a 504  after clicking "Next" to proceed with the import. However, there seems to be a small chance of success, which possibly depends on server performance and connection state.

Tests were done with two files:
* One with 101mb, 104 columns and +300.000,00 lines
* Another with 130mb 12 columns and +1.000.000,00 lines

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Go to the 'External CSV Importer'
# Upload a large CSV File (such as the ones listed above).
# Wait for the upload to finish then click 'Next' 

h3. Expected Results

Jira should do one of the following:
* Upload the file and proceed with the import
* Throw a message that it won't be importable due to the file size.

h3. Actual Results
The browser window breaks and a 504 error is thrown.
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Uploading a large CSV file with the 'External CSV Importer' is possible to fail

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Slack panel may throw a 'Client-side error' in Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Slack message with more than three lines;
# Attach this message in a Jira issue.
# Access this issue using Mozilla Firefox.

h3. Expected Results
The Slack panel is loaded correctly:
 !slack-panel-working.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
There is a *Client-side error* in the UI and the Slack panel does not load:
 !slack-panel-not-working.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
Use a different browser.
fields.summary: Issues with Slack messages attached may throw a 'Client-side error' in Firefox

fields.description:
I, as JIRA admin, would like that the default option on "Conditions" was not "All of the Following Conditions".
This can be very confusing and not work, in case any condition is added.
fields.summary: Improve the Conditions on Workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* As a Jira user, I'm trying to log work on a Jira issue. 
* When I access my Jira issue, I have the new issue view experience. 
* I cannot find the log work feature neither by clicking on the three dots fro the right nor anywhere else. 
* I'm not able to log work. 

h3. Expected Results
* Since time tracking is enabled, and time tracking field is also enabled, we are expecting to see the log work on the new Jira issue view. 

h3. Actual Results
* The feature is not shown up.

h3. Note:
* *This is only affecting independent projects (aka Agility projects)*

h3.Workaround
* Accessing the Jira issue using the search view feature can be considered a temporary workaround.
fields.summary: New Full View Issue Experience eliminates Log Work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing issues with CSV or JSON, JIRA should show an better and clearer message, in case some error occurs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an CSV file or JSON using the JIRA Exporter on Server 
# Go to *Administration > System > Import and Export > External System Import > CSV*
# Import the file 
# Proceed with the mapping and finishes
# No clear error is displayed, even though some values are not well configured.

h3. Expected Results
It would be nice if JIRA shows warning with clearer information.

h3. Actual Results
It shows an general error.
{code}
Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data maybe in a unstable state:
{code}

 !Error.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Improve Error Messages when Importing from CSV and JSON
Testing for issue rrr

fields.description:
Hi Team, 

One of my colleagues advised he used a feature at a previous role on Jira and i am wondering if this is possible. I am wondering if it is possible to add template buttons to insert an automated line of text to the note sections. I have made a mock up of what i am requesting. Are you able to advise if this is something that can be achieved in the cloud version or if this is something that can be implemented at a future date, 

 

Regards,

James
fields.summary: Template Buttons

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The mobile version of JIRA only displays assignee and reporter of an issue as we can in the screen shot below
 !jira_ios.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
JIRA Mobile 61.0.0.569

h3. Suggested Solution
Display Watchers as an expandable field in the mobile view of the ticket

h3. Why this is important
It allows the participant to know who is watching the specific ticket through visibility of the watchers field
 
h3. Workaround 
No available workaround so far
fields.summary: JIRA Mobile: Watcher field visibility
Allow apps to bypass screen security when impersonating a user

fields.description:
h3. Summary
AP.jira.refreshIssuePage fails on full-page issue view which results to the field value changes not being reflected at once.

h3. Steps to Reproduce (create an app that does the following via button click)
# Update a field in the issue
# On successful update, call AP.jira.refreshIssuePage
# In full-page issue view, click the button

h3. Expected Results
The changes in the issue will be reflected.

h3. Actual Results
The below error is shown in the developer console and the issue page did not update with the new field values.
{noformat}
batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true:501 Uncaught Error: Failed to refresh the issue page
    at Object.refreshIssuePage (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true:501)
    at a._handleRequest (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true:246)
    at a.b._receiveMessage (batch.js?adg3Enabled=true&agile_global_admin_condition=true&devsummary=true&globalSidebarEnabled=true&jag=true&jaguser=true&jira-nps-enabled=true&locale=en-US&nps-not-opted-out=true&sd_operational=true:259)
{noformat}

h3. Notes
This works fine in _scrum and kanban boards and backlogs_ view.
fields.summary: AP.jira.refreshIssuePage fails on full-page issue view

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When transitioning an issue (e.g. To Do -> In Progress), the web panels are not refreshed. Unlike the "legacy" view which updates the web panels after transition

*Steps to replicate*
# Create a web panel with location: {{atl.jira.view.issue.right.context}}
# GETting and displaying the issue in the webPanel via {{/rest/api/2/issue}} endpoint
# Change the status from "To Do" -> "In Progress" in the New Issue View
# Presented with an info message that the board has changed and that I should click on Refresh
# Even doing so, the status is still "To Do" in the web panel

h3. Background

Some of our vendors are using the webpanels to display certain content depending on the current status of an issue or using the webpanels to monitor changes made to a ticket by post functions during a transition.

See screenshots for reference
fields.summary: Jira Cloud's New Issue View should refresh app web panels after a transition

fields.description:
As a developer, when I request a review I would like that to initiate a trigger in Jira so that our workflow can ensure the related issue moves to Dev Review automatically.  Developers often forget to move the Jira issues and this would more fully automate it. It looks like Jira has that integration for Crucible. 

 

Same request for Review Approved.  Review started and Review Rejected would be nice to have as well, but Request Review and Review approved would be most important.
fields.summary: Add Review Requested and Review Approved to the GitHub integration

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Attaching images using CTRL + V erases the comment section. 

h3. Environment
* Chrome - Inconsistent
** Google Chrome Version 68.0.3440.106 (Official Build) (64-bit) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to an Issue
# Copy an image to your clipboard
# Click on JIRA to bring the page in focus
# Use CTRL+ V to attach the image
# The attachment is posted, but the comment is erased

h3. Expected Results
The attachment should be added to the comment message.

h3. Actual Results
The attachment is posted, but the page is reloaded and the comment section is erased.
Refer to the video below, which demonstrate the bug:
 [^Pasting screenshot reloads page-2.mp4] 
 
h3. Workaround
Attach Image by either the Drag and Drop method or by clicking More > Attach File
fields.summary: Attaching Images with Keyboard Shortcuts (Ctrl + V) erases all comment section

fields.description:
can't use the exclamation marks to surround characters within a code markup, they are not allowed by the code markup, but these are allowed by the other wiki render markups.

For example, within the code markup:
- \!qwerty! is not valid  
- !qwerty\! is valid
- \\!qwerty! is not valid
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 19.43.49.png|thumbnail! 

To reproduce:

# open a code block in a comment
# type "! something..."
# Try to save 

Expected:
 the comment to be saved

Actual result:
Error message, and comment not saved.

Workaround:
none, can't escape the !
fields.summary: Comments can't be added when the code block contains exclamation point ! , also, it doesn't allow to escape them

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Jira-Slack integration has options to send messages to a channel when the issue is created, assignee updated, someone leaves a comment or when the issue is transitioned to a specific status. Currently, there is no such option to send a message to a channel when the issue is updated.

For example, the only way to be notified in the Slack channel when the issue is moved to a different project is using a third-party add-on.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an *Issue updated* condition to trigger messages in the Slack channel.

h3. Why this is important
Such functionality would improve the usability of the Slack integration providing more options to keep track of issues using the Slack rooms.

h3. Workaround
Using a third-party add-on like *Automation for Jira*, or use the *Jira Server Alerts* from Slack: 
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira
https://slack.com/apps/A0F7YS3MZ-jira-server-alerts
fields.summary: Enable the 'Issue Updated' notifications in Slack

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Disabled options in a select list custom field are still displayed on Jira Mobile

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field 'select list single choice' add multiple options
# Disable an option
# Notice this option is now hidden when viewing Jira from a computer
# The option is still displayed when creating/editing an issue with Jira Mobile


h3. Expected Results
The option is hidden and cannot be selected

h3. Actual Results
The option is displayed on the mobile version of Jira
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No known workaround
fields.summary: Disabled options in a select list custom field are still displayed on Jira Mobile

fields.description:
h3. Summary

You aren''t able to create new projects. The Create Project button *appears for a few seconds and then disappears* when loading the Project Administration page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit Project Administration page:
 [https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa|https://%3Cinstance%3E.atlassian.net/secure/project/ViewProjects.jspa]
 # When browser is loading you'll see the Create Project button disappear.
  !screenshot-11.jpg|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results

The *Create Button*  should stay visible and you should be able to proceed to create new projects
h3. Actual Results

The *Create Button*  seems to load for a few seconds and then it disappears.  
h3. Workarounds
 * We need to temporarily tweak *Browse Projects Permission at Permission Scheme* to include relevant User Groups
 * In most normal scenarios , the following should work
 ** Browse to https://<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewPermissionSchemes.jspa
 ** Go to Default Permission  Scheme and Click  "Permissions" under Actions 
 ** Edit *Browse Projects Permission*
 ** Grant Permission to Group "Anyone"
fields.summary: Create Project Button Disappears in 'New Jira issue view'

fields.description:
h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud iOS app Ver 61.0.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue
# Add double-byte comments including spaces ex. "あいう あいう"

h3. Expected Results
"あいう あいう" will be loaded as a comment

h3. Actual Results
Comment shows "あいう   あいう"
 !IMG_9088.PNG|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* This will happen for a space between double byte and single byte, too. ex. "あいう abc"
* This doesn't happen in the description field

h3.Workaround
Edit the comment and remove the extra spaces. After editing, extra spaces won't be added again.
fields.summary: In the coment field of iOS app, a space between double-byte texts is automatically converted to three spaces

fields.description:
We love the new issue view in Jira Cloud! Especially that it allows you to see the details of an issue quickly and easily.

Unfortunately we cannot offer our customers the same feature as there is no way for us to open the new Issue View from within a Connect App.

This has been a long-standing (and REALLY easily fixed) short-coming in Jira as there has never been an open Edit Issue Dialog API either.

Can we please add the very simple API to allow Connect Apps to open the new Issue View instead of having to re-write the entire dialog in our app?

Thanks!
fields.summary: Open New Jira Issue View from a Connect App

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When the default language of the instance is set to any non-ASCII language (such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean), Pie Chart reports will display the Statistic Type in broken characters.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set Default language of the instance to Korean

 # Set Indexing language to English - Aggressive Stemming

 # Create users with Korean email addresses and assign issues to them or set them as reporters

 # Navigate to Reports and create a Pie Chart report using Statistic type Reporter or Assignee

 # Report will not display the correct Reporter's name but will show broken characters instead. Data Table displays the correct email address

h3. Expected Results

Pie Chart report returns the correct email address in Korean characters
h3. Actual Results

Broken characters of reporter's name is displayed in the Chart. Data Table shows correctly
  
 Workaround

Not available

!Screen Shot 2018-08-13 at 9.48.33 AM.png|width=308,height=366!
fields.summary: Pie Chart report shows broken characters when the default language is set to Korean

fields.description:
h2. Summary

The current translations for Assignee and Resolution seem incorrect in Jira Core:

assignee -> [before] 담당자 [now] 피할당자 
resolution -> [before] 해결책 [now] 해상도

It shows as "해상도" and "피할당자 " which aren't the proper term for 'Resolution' and Assignee.

h2. Customer Impact
Korean users
fields.summary: Korean translation for Assignee and Resolution is incorrect

fields.description: When reporting on sprints and projects in Jira, It would be nice to be able to create or see a report that shows the time spent on issues/stories/epics vs the original estimates so that management teams can easily compare these values and take action.
fields.summary: Add new report and Gadget to Show issue Estimates vs Actual time

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Currently, it is not possible to connect instances ending in *jira.com* with the [Atlassian Cloud for Gmail|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-for-gmail-953138538.html] add-on.

The add-on only supports *atlassian.net* and *jira-dev.com*.

h4. Problem

There are some instances under the *jira.com* domain yet.
In case they want to use the add-on, it won't work for them.

h4. Suggestion

Have Atlassian Cloud for Gmail support connections with *jira.com* instances.
fields.summary: Have Atlassian Cloud for Gmail support jira.com instances

fields.description:
When creating a comment in a Jira issue, if a word has a hyperlinklink and is also in a preformatted section, the hyperlink will be lost in Jira's new issue view

This comment:

 !comment1.png|thumbnail! 


Will be displayed in the old issue view like:

 !comment 2.png|thumbnail! 


However, in the new issue view, the hyperlink gets lost, confirmed also by the black font (as opposed to blue in the old issue view):

 !comment3.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: link in a preformatted text inside a comment gets removed in Jira's New issue view

fields.description:
h2. Problem Description

This only happens to the New Jira Issue View
When an image is indented by bullet point or numbers, it is not showing when the issue is loaded

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Steps to Replicate

Create an issue and attach an image, use the following test to add inline image to the issue:
{noformat}
* This is a bullet
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

# This is a number
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
{noformat}

h2. Expected Result

 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
Picture shows up when issue loads

h2. Actual Result

 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 
Inline images are gone

h2. Workaround

To turn off the new Jira issue view:
# Click on your user profile picture at the lower left corner
# Select Personal Settings
# Under Jira labs, click on the tick box to disable the view

Alternatively, you can add a new line in between, so the image is not indented
fields.summary: Inline Image Not Showing After Indenting On the New Jira Issue View

fields.description:
Some customers user Google SSO to access Atlassian Cloud products.

Google Apps only supports Android Work Profiles. However, when users install the Jira and Confluence apps they are not able to login because the Atlassian apps are not configured to use Work Profiles.

It would be good if Atlassian apps can support Work Profiles.
fields.summary: Support of Android Work Profiles

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In *Microsoft Edge*, assignee field is always empty, when exists in a separate screen tab.

h3. Environment
* Microsoft Edge

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a screen and add a new tab
# Add assignee field to the new tab
# Create an issue
# Assign the issue
# Edit the issue

h3. Expected Results
Assignee remains unchanged

h3. Actual Results
Assignee field is changed to unassigned. In the seperate tab, you'll see

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


h3.Workaround
Use other browsers. ie. Chrome or Mozilla Firefox
fields.summary: MS Edge: empty assignee field when present in a separate screen tab

fields.description:
Currently, when you log work in Jira, the time spent field is compulsory. Users would like the ability to enter the Time estimate (time remaining) without having to log the time spent on the issue.

The time spent field should be made optional to allow users log remaining estimate without providing the time spent.
fields.summary: Log Remaining time without time spent

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Make {{/rest/api/2/settings/columns}} available to apps.

h3. Background

We are working on the cloud version of our popular data exporter add-on that would allow users to export data from Issue Navigator in a table format. Accessing the REST API and rendering is done from our own server (using a bearer token). As a Jira core feature, the user can select one from at most 3 column configurations in Issue Navigator (My Default, Filter, System). Let's assume they select "System". We would like to allow our users to see the same columns in the exported file as they see in their browser, so we try to call the /rest/api/2/settings/columns REST API endpoint to gather column names. According to the manual, this endpoint has an "Apps cannot access this REST resource" disclaimer and when we try to access it, it returns an HTTP 401 error. We need access to this endpoint otherwise our users will not see the same columns in the exported file as they see in Jira which is very confusing for them.
fields.summary: Make /settings/columns available to apps

fields.description:
*Summary*
User gets locked on on-boarding welcome page.

*Environment*

*Steps to Reproduce*
# User starts on-boarding as Jira administrators in an SD only instance
# Enters the first page in onboaring
# User loses administrator rights on this stage
# User is forced to create a project to proceed, but doesn't have permission to do so:
!sd-onboarding-error.png|thumbnail!

*Expected Results*
The user leaves the on-boarding welcome page.

*Actual Results*
The user gets locked on on-boarding welcome page.

*Workaround*
Contact Atlassian Support
fields.summary: User gets locked on onboarding welcome page

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Custom fields formatting is not converted to markdown in the new Jira issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a project with a text custom field using the Wiki Renderer;
# Add some formatting in this field, using [wiki markup|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=all];
# Turn on the new Jira issue view.

h3. Expected Results
The custom field should retain its formatting, similar to system fields.
Here's an example of two fields, *Description* and a *Custom text field* with the same formatting:
 !text-formatting-old-view.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Only system fields are correctly formatted. Custom fields will be displayed with plain text:
 !text-formatting-new-view.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
Regardless if the custom field is using the *Default Text Renderer* or the *Wiki Style Renderer*, it's not possible to add any formatting in the field.

h3.Workaround
Disable the Labs in the user profile in order to disable the new issue view (only for Software project):
 !profile-labs.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Custom fields formatting is not converted to markdown in the new Jira issue view

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
We are excited to announce that we have moved tabs back to the left hand side of Jira Cloud's new issue view. By moving tabs to the left admins are able to make better use of the space available on the issue view and create layouts that work for every member of their team. You can find our more in our [official announcement|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/New-to-Jira-discussions/Tabs-are-now-on-the-left-hand-side-of-Jira-Cloud-s-issue-view/m-p/1614901].
{panel}

h3. Summary

The screen tabs are not visible in the new Jira issue view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a project with some [screen tabs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/defining-a-screen-938847288.html] configured.
 # Turn on [the new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html], and open the issue.

h3. Expected Results

In the old view, the tabs are displayed:
 !old-issue-view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

All the content is cluttered in the context bar (the right side of the issue)
 !new-issue-view.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Disable the *Labs* in the user profile in order to disable the new issue view:
 !profile-labs.png|thumbnail!

+Update:+ 
 *The actual workaround only work for Software Project and there is no available workarounds for the Business/Core projects excepted to go click the _Use the old view_ on every Business tickets* they are working on to retrieve the Screen Tabs field's organisations. 
 Having all the fields ordered as a list can be painful if they are using lot of custom fields and were using the screen's tabs to organise the custom_fields.
fields.summary: The screen tabs are not visible in the new Jira issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating an issue using the pop-up create issue screen, it only allows you to select security levels you have access too, however; when using the inline create issue, it will use the default security level even if the user doesn't have permission to the level.

 

 
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two security levels (Admin & Users)
 # Give *Administrators* access to the *Admin* level
 # Give *Any logged in user* access to *Users*.
 # Make *Admin* default level
 # Login as a *non-Administrator* user

 * When using create issue screen, the user can pick from the security levels (None or User)
 !image-2018-08-10-10-05-04-961.png|thumbnail! 
 * When using the inline create issue, there is no screen so it will use the default level (*Admin*) even though I don't have Admin permissions. 
 !inlinecreateissue.png|thumbnail! 

     6. Create issue via inline create issue
h3. Expected Results

 The user can access the issue after creation
h3. Actual Results

The user can't access the issue because the *Admin* level applies to the issue.
h3. Notes

When using the inline create issue, it should not use the default level if the user doesn't have access to the default level. I believe it should use *None* if the user doesn't have access.
h3. Workaround

Use create issue screen

 !image-2018-08-10-10-05-04-961.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User can create issues with a security level that they don't have permission to access

fields.description:
This is for the Site Administration, in particular for about adding new users.
 
 Please, can you please change the setting that, when adding someone with a domain different from my company's one, the box for allowing everyone with the same domain to be able to sign up spontaneously is unticked.
 This should not happen, especially if in the Site access section it has been selected that only invited people can join. Please, see attached picture
 
 Needless to say, that this has caused to us issues more than once, as accidentally our platform has been opened up to externals unwillingly.
 
 Could you please change the box default status to "unticked"?
 
 Many thanks
fields.summary: Inviting users external with a domain different from the company's one invites to open up for registration to anyone sharing the added person's domain

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the option to set thumbnail size only available for JIRA Server. It will be great if this option available for Cloud.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide option to set the thumbnail size

h3. Why this is important
The current thumbnail size in Cloud instance is small. 

h3. Workaround 
Use wiki renderer syntax to set the thumbnail size , for example :-
{noformat}
!Apple.png|thumbnail, width=300,height=400!  
{noformat}
fields.summary: Ability to set the thumbnail size

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Whenever using IE 11 (tested with win 8.1). We don't see the memory consumption being well handled. So from the point that you start navigating, even when using a single window, the memory consumption only raises.

*Update* confirmed to see similar behavior on Edge

Comparing to other applications and also, Jira on other browser the behaviour is to control the memory consumption, so that it doesn't use excessive memory.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open Internet Explorer.
 # Start navigating Jira
 # Monitor performance (more specifically memory consumption)

h3. Expected Results

As it happens with other applications on IE and with Jira in other browsers, it should run garbage collection in order to free some memory periodically.

As we can see in the examples:
{quote}In these examples:
 * The *{color:#de350b}red line{color}* is the number of bytes committed for the whole system, when running the test with only that application open, in a scale in which 10 = 1gb of memory
 * The {color:#0747a6}blue line{color}, is the % of all the available memory in usage{quote} *  Google Chrome running Jira (simply navigating through Jira with a single tab, around 4 mins of navigation)
 !Jira_chrome.png|thumbnail!

  
 * Internet Explorer running Youtube (4 mins of navigation, opening videos and other screens)
 !youtube_IE.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

Garbage Collection isn't run and memory consumption only Increases.
 * Internet Explorer running Jira (simply navigating through Jira with a single tab, around 4 mins of navigation).
 !Jira_IE.png|thumbnail!

Notice that, besides the increasing memory usage, the total amount (on the top left), only for IE is very high, even using only a single tab.
h3. Workaround
 * Consider using another browser
 * Close and re-open IE from time to time.

h3. Notes

The tests are internally documented on video.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud on Internet Explorer 11 causes memory leak

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When importing very large files to Jira Cloud, the import may fail and the task stop and set as DEAD. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Generate a very large Jira import file (replicated with ~6GB of entities.xml and ~2GB of activeobjects.xml)
# Import that to Jira Cloud

h3. Expected Results
Import works.

h3. Actual Results
Import fails and the following errors can be seen in logs:
{code}
com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.ImportFlowManager$ImportFlowException: There is no active import task. Requested to complete import task with id: 10117
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.ImportFlowManagerImpl.doCompleteImportFlow(ImportFlowManagerImpl.java:172)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.ImportFlowManagerImpl.completeImportFlow(ImportFlowManagerImpl.java:138)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy280.completeImportFlow(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:302)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
[...]
at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.TaskThread$WrappingRunnable.run(TaskThread.java:61)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
{code}
 
h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Very large imports may cause import to terminate

fields.description:
h3.Summary

Currently the web container in the Slack integration page in JIRA is cut off half way. Statuses are not fully displayed due to this.

h3.Steps to Replicate

Just navigate to the Slack integration page and perform an integration in any project. Ensure that the test project have a lot of status. 

h3.Current Behavior

The drop down box is cut off half way currently

!broken1.png|thumbnail!

h3.Expected Behavior

Once expanded the drop down shows completely.

!broken.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround 

No workaround for now besides tempering the HTML code from the developer console.
fields.summary: The web container view in the Slack integration page in JIRA is cut off

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to transition status in New Jira View when the transition has a screen
h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 !newview.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add screen to transition on workflow
 # Head to issue and transition

h3. Expected Results

The issue should transition
h3. Actual Results

The issue shows a loading icon but doesn't update the status
 !image-2018-08-09-09-47-52-459.png|thumbnail!

 
h3. Notes

This New Issue view looks brand new; I can't find it on any of my test instances.

See below a screenshot of my test instance:

!image-2018-08-09-09-53-11-517.png|thumbnail!

As I don't have this new view, I did tests on the customer's instance ([Video on Google Drive|https://drive.google.com/open?id=1jtuBjPeaAt1bxU8nV7722z3lz3WXjava])
h3. Workaround

Disable New Jira View or Head to Issue itself instead of viewing from filter
fields.summary: New Jira issue view can't transition status when the transition has a screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Can't grant users project permissions while using IE 11.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a  project.
# Click on the *Project Settings* (cog icon) > click on *People* tab.
# Click the *Add People*.
# Try typing into the box.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to search for the user/group and grant it a project permission. 

h3. Actual Results
When you try to search for the user/group, the searching wheel keeps spinning and the letters you type don't appear. 

Check [this video|https://cl.ly/3U0s3Q2m1F0E] I recorded while facing that behavior.

h3.Solution / Workaround
Use a different browser such as *Chrome* or *Firefox*.
fields.summary: Can't grant users project permission on Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In [new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] there's no option to link a Confluence page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access an issue in [new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html]
# Following quick-add buttons are available where there's no option for linking a Confluence page:
 !New Jira issue view - Quick-add buttons.png|thumbnail! 
# There's no option to link Confluence page in issue menu as well:
 !New Jira issue view - Menu options.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
An option (e.g quick-add button) to link Confluence page. This is possible in _old issue view_ as per following steps:
# Access issue in _old issue view_, you may use this URL: https://<instance-name>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue-key>/?oldIssueView=true
# Click on issue menu, and select *Link*:
 !Old issue view - Menu options.png|thumbnail! 
# Following dialog appears where you can link a Confluence page

h3. Actual Results
There is no option (e.g quick-add button) to link a Confluence page

h3. Workaround
Click on *See the old view* in the [new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/the-new-jira-issue-view-938040503.html] to see the issue in old view.

h3. Update 
This feature request also applies to Jira Issue and Web Link, since all options are in the same feature (Link).
fields.summary: Unable to use the link feature in the 'new Jira issue view'
Creating another issue with a user picker and a text field already prefills both fields (email retains value from previous issue created and user picker defaults to 'admin')

fields.description:
h3. *Description*

Outlook format messages in HTML tables in order to indent images and links, so when JIRA receives a message and parses to Wiki Markup the message is processed not as expected. The tables layouts are broken and are not aligned due to Outlook message format as we can see on the screenshot below.
fields.summary: Improve HTML parse for emails received from Outlook

fields.description:
This is not a suggestions but I am unable to file a bug or a support request due to the misconfigured JRACLOUD Create Issue screen.

 

On Jira Cloud searching for words containing a "-" sometimes works but often does not. It seems like it may be caused by some fields that use different types of formatting? Sometimes * creates a bold font and sometimes it creates an asterisk for example.
fields.summary: Quick search doesn't work for words containing a "-"

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the dashboard page, some gadgets stop to work after changing screen size.
Example of gadget: Agile Wallboard Gadget

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Access the instance using Firefox *edit - (for some users, its also reproducible with Chrome)
# Go to the dashboard page
# Add the Current Active Sprint gadget
# Wait for the page to load and display the columns and cards form the gadget
# Re-scale the browser, the gadget will no longer display the data

[reproducing|https://cl.ly/2o2r1X3E0G0e]

h3. Expected results
After changing screen size it should reload the gadget and display it content

h3. Actual results
The render crashes and the gadget stop to display its content

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround, it requires to reload the page as the browser its unable to render after changing screen size
fields.summary: At the dashboard page some gadgets stop to work after changing screen size.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

* As an admin, I'm editing the workflow. 
* I'm updating specifically the parameter of the post function *Update Issue Custom Field*.
* The custom field is of type *Text Field (multi-line)*. 
* No Character count limit is stated for the use of the type *Text Field (multi-line)* nor for the post function *Update Issue Custom Field* parameter. However, a 404 error shows up when we addded more text. 
* We estimated the text size for 16k character. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create custom field of type *Text Field (multi-line)*. 
#*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Add post function *Update Issue Custom Field* to the workflow. 
#*  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
# Try adding a big dummy text of 16k character. 
# The post function will be updated. 
# Try adding more one character to that big dummy text. 

h3. Expected Results
* The parameter is updated.

h3. Actual Results
* A 404 error is thrown and the parameter is not updated. 
*   !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
# We can find on the developer panel that the *Header* include the *old value* (parameter is called *dummy field*) and the *new value* as shown in the short video below (which may be the reason for not completing the request and getting an answer or actually getting a 404 answer):
#*  [^Recording #221.mp4] 
# I was not able to replicate the issue in one test instance and I was able to replicate it in another test instance (Please check internal comment for further details). 

h3.Workaround
Currently no workaround to prevent this happening.
fields.summary: 404 error thrown when updating post function Update Issue Custom Field - Text Field (multi-line)

fields.description:
Currently, we can only search for all priorities and single priority, but there is no information where we can see what is the default priority.
 It would be great if we could add parameters to /rest/api/2/priority/ and /rest/api/2/priority/\{id} to check which one is the default priority.
fields.summary: Add a flag to see which priority is default via API

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes a message isn't delivered to a customer and it is required to contact Atlassian support to verify what happened. If the message has bounced for some reason and the customer email address entered in a blocking list, only Atlassian is able to see this information and remove the block.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add inside JIRA the option to see all failed notification deliveries, and the reason (nonexistent user, temporary local problem, etc.) and in turn allow Cloud site-admins the ability to remove this block if present.
fields.summary: Show undelivered email messages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when bulk deleting issue, the delete screen will only show the number of issues being deleted.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the project(s) that contain the affected issues when bulk deleting issues.
fields.summary: Bulk delete issue screen should show the project(s) that contains the issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Quote block text formatting does not work in the New JIRA Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Use the ** format on any text fields (description, comments,...)

h3. Expected Results

!Block_Quote_in_Stories.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Actual Results

!_CLEAN-29__testingmore_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

Example format used in test
{noformat}
h2. Quote block testing (BAD)

{quote}
this is a test for the quote block formatting in JIRA wiki renderable fields
{quote}

h2. End of test
{noformat}

When refreshing the page, the correct formatting is shown for a brief second as seen below

 !2018-08-07_16-28-41.gif! 

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Quote block text formatting does not work

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When setting up a webhook to get triggered based on the event *Version_updated*, the value received for the "released" parameter is inaccurate.

h6. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create webhook for events *Version unreleased* and *Version updated*
 ** !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 # Unrelease the version
 ** !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h6. Expected Results

Receive two webhooks: One for *update_version* and the other one for *unrelease_version*
 * For both of them the value "released": false

h6. Actual Results
 * For *unrelease_version* event: the value "released": false.
 ** !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
 * However, for *update_version* event: the value "released": true.
 ** !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: updated (jira:version_updated) webhook provide inaccurate information

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Gadget  *Time to first response* rely on the *[CHART] Date of First Response* custom field. This custom field can be deleted, which breaks those gadgets.

Users, unaware of what deleting this custom field can cause, may delete it and prevent the gadgets from working.

h3. Suggested Solution
 
Prevent users from deleting this field (and even maybe hiding it from the custom fields page)

h3. Workaround 
If that field was deleted, recreate it with *Data of first response* type (and the very same name).
fields.summary: Prevent users from deleting the [CHART] Date of First Response

fields.description:
In a Jira Software Cloud site you  could  refresh the Activity of the entire site and loadin more results by clicking  "Show More" button, It was showed more than 100 results . 

Since 06/08/2018 we care about  the button "Show more..."  !image-2018-08-06-16-35-55-840.png!  

dissapear after shown 100 results.

Could you restore back the funcionality to show more than 100 activity registers in The Activity Stream. It happens in the Activity Stream  gadget  and in the Actity page view of a particular Project.
fields.summary: Remove 100 results restriction in Activity Stream Gadget

fields.description: Currently, Atlassian cloud sites are accessible to everyone from any network all the times. It would very handy to be able to restrict the access to cloud site to certain IPs only. One business case can be to allow users to access cloud site from a particular network like work-place only.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict cloud site access to certain IP addresses

fields.description:
Hello,

we test at the moment how we can work with Jira in a efficient way.

I think the Kanban Board is most suitable for us.

But there I've come to some problems with the view ...

It's nice that tasks get but together under the story
 # ... but would be nice if i could open the story, when I click on the tag
 # I would like to be able to drag the whole story
 # I would like to divide a story - to drag a task out of the story frame to priorize all the tasks without looking at the story 

 

 

!image-2018-08-05-14-25-19-569.png|width=833,height=509!
fields.summary: Kanban Boards - better view with stories

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When viewing a ticket in Safari 11.1.2 on macOS 10.13.6, it will use significant CPU even after the page has finished loading

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Opens two pages in a instance and check the Activity Monitor.
The page in focus on Saffari will have it's using around 10%.
If you change them, the activity will vary between them.

*Expected:* Not have that much of usage by the browser.

*Actual:* The focus page uses around 10% of the CPU.

h3. Workaround

Use another browser seems to be a good option.
fields.summary: Viewing a ticket uses too much CPU in Safari, hurting battery life

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
I'd like to have the ability to customize date ranges on gadgets. The date ranges are not dynamic. They are fixed on daily, monthly, annually.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create the ability to customize a date range for gadgets.
fields.summary: Ability to customize dates on gadgets

fields.description:
Our public documentation [Importing data from CSV|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-csv-776636762.html] has incorrect instructions regarding how to import attachments from CSV.

Under *Importing attachments*, the instructions are:
{quote}
You can attach files to issues created from your CSV file. To do this, specify the URL of your attachment in an Attachments column within your CSV file.

{code}
Assignee, Summary, Description, Attachment, Comment
Admin, "Issue demonstrating the CSV attachment import", "Please check the attached image below.", "https://jira-server:8080/secure/attachment/image-name.png", "01/01/2012 10:10;Admin; This comment works"
Admin, "CSV attachment import with timestamp,author and filename", "Please check the attached image below.", "01/01/2012 13:10;Admin;image.png;file://image-name.png", "01/01/2012 10:10;Admin; This comment works"
{code}
 
Note that URLs for attachments support the HTTP and HTTPS protocols and can be located anywhere that your Jira Cloud site can access.
{quote}

This leads to believe that users can import files from CSV if they are in your local environment. However, in Cloud, this is not possible.

Instead, we should be instructing users to use public FTP Server to upload their images before importing them via CSV.
 * *Note:* In this case Google Drive is not applicable, as file paths are provided with hashes that cannot be resolved by Jira.
fields.summary: Importing data from CSV documentation has incorrect instructions

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

It is not possible to set the timezone to *America - (GMT-06:00) Center* or *(GMT-03:00) Buenos Aires*.

An error is displayed when clicking to save the change.


h3. Environment
Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the profile icon -> *Personal settings*:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-03 at 10.49.13.png|thumbnail! 
# Set the timezone options as : *America* -  *(GMT-06:00) Center*:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-03 at 10.49.41.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on *Save changes*. An error message will be displayed:
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-03 at 10.50.09.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The changes should be saved.

h3. Actual Results
An error message is displayed and the timezone is not set.

h3. Workaround
You could use an equivalent time zone, like using *(GMT-03:00) Sao Paulo* instead of *(GMT-03:00) Buenos Aires*, however, the user may be affected by daylight saving periods that may be different in each city.
fields.summary: Cannot set the timezone to America or Buenos Aires.

fields.description: I want to assign the issue to multiple users but there has provision for only one user so how can it will be  visible to boss and team leader also
fields.summary: Help for issue create

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Navigating through multiple issues in Jira Software board can result in blank issue view in the sidebar.

This is affecting a board that contain a total number of issues which in turn requires users to scroll up or down the board.

Error thrown in browser's console:
!console_error.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Create a project with a scrum board.
# Create 50 issues in the project.
# Start a sprint with all the 50 issues.
# Make sure the issues will be viewed in sidebar by clicking on the ellipses at the top right-hand corner and click on *Open issues in sidebar*.
# Navigate(click to view in sidebar) through a few issues at the top of the board.
# Scroll to the bottom of the board and start to navigate more issues there.

*NOTE*: A more random navigation to view the issues at the bottom of the board will have a higher chance in triggering the bug.

h3. Current result
Issue view in the sidebar is blank for some issues.

h3. Expected result
Issue view works fine.

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the board will fix the view temporarily. Further navigation can re-trigger the bug.
fields.summary: Blank sidebar issue view in board

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JIRA search rest API endpoint is not returning the correct issues for the given JQL when done with the GET method.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Do a get operation against the search endpoint. E.g:
{noformat}
 https://{instancename}.net/rest/api/2/search?jql=project={pkey}&issuetype=Story
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results

The result should only contain issues form the specified pkey and of the Story type.

h3. Actual Results

The result will contain issues that are not Story and issues from other projects
 
h3. Notes

Per our tests, this bug is happening for any search with more than one field.

h3.Workaround

Use a POST method to the endpoint and it should work fine:
* [The Jira Cloud platform REST API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-search-post]
fields.summary: Problems with search API endpoint when using the GET method

fields.description: Would you add a viewing/editing mode where all unresolved comments are always visible, a-la Google Docs?  It is nice to see all related issues in a glance, especially when multiple people are working on the same page.  In some workflows, easy discoverability of open comments is important.  In my company, this holding up wide adoption of Confluence - people prefer GDoc commenting.
fields.summary: Collaboration mode for viewing/editing a page

fields.description:
This version of Jira uses the legacy view which is awesome.

Unfortunately, our version has been switched to the new UI where I can't find any buttons.

Thanks for ruining my productivity for several months.

https://accuweather.atlassian.net
fields.summary: New UI is poor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to define a [project URL|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/editing-a-project-s-details-938021482.html] for Agility Projects

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to define a Project URL on Agility projects.

h3. Why this is important
Even for Agility Projects, users should be able to provide an address to documentation about the project, roadmaps or other important content outside of their Jira site.
 
h3. Workaround 
- If the Project URL is critical, consider using another Project Template which is not Agility Project.
fields.summary: Provide the Project URL field for Agility Projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* When a new user is created via {{POST /rest/api/2/user}}
* For endpoint details see: https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/#api-api-2-user-post

h3. Environment
* Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make a {{POST}} request to {{/rest/api/2/user}}
# In the {{POST}} body, make the email address match an existing user, the username(name) can be different
# Send the request and check the response

h3. Expected Results
* A message informing the person who made the request that an account with that email address already exists.  Something like "User already exists"

h3. Actual Results
* 201 response with details of the user with the existing email address
 
h3. Notes
* A duplicate account is not created
* Identity advised that they use a 409 response in these cases

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds
fields.summary: REST API: Create user endpoint responds with a 201(response contains existing user details) if a duplicate user is created

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The System Fields below are not translated to [supported languages|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/languages-744721667.html]:
 - Request participants
 - Organizations

The verified languages are:
 - Spanish
 - Chinese
 - Japanese

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a issue in Service Desk project
 # Go to "Personal settings" and change the "Language" to Japanese
 # Browser the issue as a agent
 # Confirm the strings
 !Screenshot 2018-08-02 15.20.36.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The strings are translated to the configured language.
h3. Actual Results

The strings are rendered in English.
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Some of System Fields are not translated

fields.description:
During JQL search, it would be useful to have a means to not only search the assignee of an issue but also who performed the action.

So lets user A assigns an issue to User B. User B becomes the assignee. Currently, there's no way to JQL search that user Assigned the issue.

This would be helpful when you need to identify self-assigned issues or issues assign by a user.
fields.summary: JQL search for the user who assigned an Issue

fields.description: Currently, any valid user in Jira can be set as project lead, whereas, it should only be set to a user who has access to the project in Jira.
fields.summary: Project lead should only be set to a user who has access to project in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

- When changing the language to Spanish, due date calendar does not show week 2 and it has 54 weeks in 2018.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Change your personal settings to Spanish.
# Click on create and use a form that has the field "Due Date" or "Fecha de Vencimento".

h3. Expected Results

- It shows the same calendar as any other language.

h3. Actual Results

- It does not show week 2.
- The calendar shows 54 weeks.
 
h3. Notes

- If the language is set to English, it shows correctly the week two and the year has 53 weeks.
- For 2017 and 2019 it shows correctly for any language.
fields.summary: When changing the language to Spanish, due date calendar does not shows week 2 and it has 54 weeks on 2018

fields.description:
*Summary*

When using IE, trying to add an user in the "People" page doesn't work and get stuck in a loop.
The browser console doesn't display any error.

*Steps to Reproduce*

# Access the settings of an project on IE;
# Click to "Add People";
# Type anything;
# The loop will start - check below screenshot.
 
!Looping.png|thumbnail! 

*Workaround*

Use another browser seems to be a valid workaround.
Otherwise, the permission will need to be changed to groups or users.
fields.summary: Adding People on a Project using IE keeps Looping

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the new JIRA issue view that is applicable to the full issue view page and board detail view of issues is not displaying the Account and Team fields from the Tempo add-on.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add support for these fields so it can be shown in the issue details and full view.
 
h3. Workaround 

Disable the new JIRA issue view under the Labs section inside the user profile for Software project. 

*Update:*
Noticed that depending on either the project is Software, Core or Agility, the New Issue View has different behaviour. It shows the add-on's fields for the Software and Agility projects, but not for the Core projects.
+This bug is faced for Core/Business project using the New Issue View and there is no workaround as the Lab feature is only for Software project+, where the add-on's fields are showed. Also, showed for Agility projects.
fields.summary: Add support for Tempo fields in new jira issue view

fields.description:
The new JIRA issue view still don't have the option to restrict comments.

Old JIRA issue view.
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-01 at 10.34.16.png|thumbnail!

New JIRA issue view.
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-01 at 10.32.57.png|thumbnail!

Please implement the comment restriction for the new JIRA issue view.
fields.summary: Implement comment restriction for the JIRA issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Provide the ability to move / shift the icons(star, search, create) in the left navigation bar.

h3. Suggested Solution
None

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Ability to move or shift the icons in left navigation bar

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When using the *Quick search* on Boards and entering multiple terms, they do not combine to perform a search using the *AND* operator.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the *Quick search*, type in 2 keywords that can be found in the summary of 2 different Issues (eg: test orange)

h3. Expected Results
In the background, JIRA combines the 2 terms and executes this search as *text ~ "'test' || 'orange'"* and the 2 Issues matching this search should appear

h3. Actual Results
JIRA does not combine the terms and actually executes the search as *text ~ "test orange"*, therefore no Issues will match the search nor be displayed

 !SCRUM_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA.png|thumbnail! 

 !SCRUM_board_-_Agile_Board_-_JIRA_search.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
In [Search syntax for text fields|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-764478343.html] it is mentioned that "_If you combine multiple terms without specifying any Boolean operators, they will be joined using AND operators_". This behaviour is noticed using the general *Quick search* as well outside of Boards.

h3.Workaround
No workaround on the Board, outside of the Board you can use the Advanced search.
fields.summary: Quick search does not combine multiple terms on Boards

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

At the moment it is not possible to create custom outgoing mail handlers as it is part of the *Cloud Restricted Functions* mentioned here:
 * https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/what-are-the-differences-between-jira-cloud-and-jira-server/

This is a hassle for customers who would like to change the email that is sending notification emails from JIRA.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement customisation of outgoing mail handlers
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Allow custom outgoing mail handlers in Cloud

fields.description:
We should include the details about the New SMTP Addresses used in the Cloud Environment on the IP/Domain Page to consolidate the list of Domains/IPs Customers should whitelist in their environments: 

Include:
{quote}jira@mail-us.atlassian.net on behalf of Sender <jira@your_instance>
jira@mail-eu.atlassian.net on behalf of Sender <jira@your_instance>
confluence@mail-us.atlassian.net on behalf of Sender <confluence@your_instance>
confluence@mail-eu.atlassian.net on behalf of Sender <confluence@your_instance>{quote}
As a part of the Outbound Email Section - https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=744721662
fields.summary: Include Jira SMTP Addresses on Cloud IP/Domains Page

fields.description:
Due to correspondence restrictions between relevant users of an issue, it would definitely be helpful to allow multiple email threads to be active regarding a single issue. Right now, when non-participants respond to an email thread from a ticket, it generates a completely brand new ticket.

This would allow users to correspond to a ticket without being directly added as a "Request Participant" in the issue itself.
fields.summary: Allow for multiple email threads per issue

fields.description:
h3. Problem description:
 * Webhooks that are triggered by *Workflow post functions* are not fired if the Webhook uses JQL to filter which issues trigger them.

h3. How to reproduce:
 # Create a webhook and define a JQL for it
 !Screen Shot 2018-08-02 at 5.13.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
  !Screen Shot 2018-08-02 at 5.12.07 PM.png|thumbnail!  
 # Add a _post function_ to any workflow transition to fire the webhook 
 # Create an issue and run the transition where the _post function_ was added

h3. Expected result:
 * Webhook will be triggered

h3. Actual result:
 * Webhook never receives the event

h3. Workaround:
 * Remove the JQL defined for the webhook
fields.summary: Webhook triggered by workflow transition does not work if JQL is defined

fields.description:
h1. Request

It would be nice to see even some basic conditional logic that can be done in filters.
h1. Reason

Some filter results return empty objects such as openSprints() if there is not an active sprint.
h1. Issue

This means that some dashboards could just be empty or require double the widgets to show two different sets of data.

Example: openSprints() / futureSprints()
h1. Proposition

For instance, if you were able to write the following statement:

If( openSprints() == Null )\{ return futureSprints() }

elseIf( openSprints() != Null )\{ return openSprints() }

or written as a ternary operator:

if( openSprint() == Null, return futureSprints(), return openSprints() )
h1. Adoption of Use

I would imagine there a quite a few people that would welcome this feature, since many people use and understand Microsoft Excel functions and conditional logic is being used in more widely adopted software like MailChimp.

There seems to be a trend to offer simplified conditional logic for general purpose, and custom scripting for more advanced users. I think this is where Jira has an opportunity to cater to both those individuals.
h1. References

[How to Use Conditional Statements in Search Filter|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/How-to-Use-Conditional-Statements-in-Search-Filter/qaq-p/851838?utm_source=atlcomm&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=immediate_general_reply&utm_content=topic]
fields.summary: Conditional Logic in Filters

fields.description:
Hello guys!

It's not an important thing, but IMO - when you're clicking on "Queues" in the left bar of Service Desk project - it shouldn't reload the main page and redirect you to all the issues, it only should open the list of the queues in the same left bar and only after choosing some existing queue - reload the page. 

It's annoying me a bit since I use this interface quite often. 

Best from Amsterdam,

Ivan.
fields.summary: Clicking on "queues" button in service desk projects should not reload the page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*Atlassian Update, May 27th, 2019:*
Hello,

This issue is fixed. The project releases page loads correctly if there are quotes ("") in the project name.

Thanks,
Jira product management team
{panel}

h3. Summary:
If the project name has double quotes symbol (i.e., *{color:#DE350B}*"*{color}*), Components or Releases page can't be accessed within that project.

h3. Steps to replicate
Create a Jira Scrum or Kanban project with one of the below naming formats, and try to access Components or Releases page.
{noformat}
Scrum "Project"
Scrum "Project
Scrum Project"
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Avoid using double quotes in the project name. 

If it's compulsory, use single quotes instead.
{noformat}
Scrum 'Project'
{noformat}
fields.summary: Components or Releases page doesn't load if the Project Name has double quotes symbol (") in it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If we have a custom field (single picker user) set in a workflow.
Adding with that, we have a post function *clear field value of that custom field*.

When transitioning a status that has that post function, the email notification does not get sent out to that assigned custom field.
Regardless if the post function value is set above or below the *fire a generic event*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field (single user picker)
# Ensure notifications(fire a generic event) and permissions(browse project, create issue, issue commented, issue assigned) are set
# Go to workflow and choose one status
#Add a post function in the status. (clear field value set to "custom field created")
# Create an issue and assign the custom field created.
# transition the status where the post function was added, see if the email is received.

h3. Expected Results
Email should receive by the assignee

h3. Actual Results
No emails received

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: When transition a status with the post function *clear field value* for a custom field (single user picker). The email notification does not get send out

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a Jira Administrator/Site Administrator, I would like to be able to manage users and the application access in the Jira Cloud app. 

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create an admin section where a Jira Administrator can invite, deactivate and remove users.
fields.summary: Administration page in Jira Cloud app (iOS and Android)

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the board filter is based on the project category, then it will not retrieve the project issues due to recent change in search.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This is affecting only some Jira Cloud applications.
# Change the project filter to use the category to retrieve the issues
# The board will stop to display the issues

h3. Expected Results
The board should retrieve the issues if the filter use the project category

h3. Actual Results
The board is no longer be able to retrieve the issues to be displayed

h3.Workaround
Change the filter to use the project name instead of using the project category or contact support.
fields.summary: Board no longer displaying issue if the filter is based on project category

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*
When customer enters quick search e.g. ABC-12 a list of issues is shown, like ABC-125. Narrowing the search to ABC-125 and the issue ABC-125 is not shown anymore.

h3. Environment
*
*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Select quick search
2. Enter ABC-12 -> ABC 125 is shown
3. also type the 5 (key= ABC-125) and ABC-125 does not show, although enter brings you to the Edit of ABC-125

h3. Expected Results
Shown issues include ABC-125 in the example

h3. Actual Results
ABC-125x (x >= 0 & not space)

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
Enter the exact key to get to the Edit screen
fields.summary: Quick search does not show issue when entered key is completely entered

fields.description: It would be a handy feature to have in Jira to be able to set a reminder when an issue reaches a particular status in the workflow. For instance, if a certain status says the issue is on hold or paused, it would be very handy if a reminder can be set for a certain time. And notify the people involved in the ticket when paused/on-hold time is over to about to be over.
fields.summary: Reminder functionality in Jira when issue reaches a certain status

fields.description: Some Jira users cannot scroll in the _View Issue_ screen. This impacts the ability of creating comments in issues
fields.summary: users cannot scroll through the View Issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The user list in the People section is not showing up in Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In any project, go to *Project Settings* and open the *People* section;
# Hit the *Add people* button;
# Select a role and start typing to look for users/groups.

h3. Expected Results
Once you start typing you should see a list of users and groups:
 !people-user-list.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Nothing show up. If you type in the search box, it's not possible to see what was inserted and no users or groups are listed:
 !people-broken.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
- The problem is not reproducible in other browsers so far, just on Internet Explorer 11.
- Regardless the browser, sometimes there is a spinning wheel in the search box which may be misleading - Users and groups are only listed once the user start typing.

h3.Workaround
Use a different browser.
fields.summary: The user list in the People section is not showing up in Internet Explorer 11

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Due to a bug in the front end, not all statuses are shown when configuring the Jira events that should send a notification. It looks like the drop-down is cropped. See screenshot below:

!jiraslack.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud, Slack
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a Jira < > Slack integration.
 # In Slack, type _/jira_ to summon the application.
 # Click on _Manage Subscription_. The Jira Cloud site opens.
 # On one of the Project → Team → Channel integration, click *Edit*
 # Drop down the statuses. The issue is visible if the workflow contains a fairly large amount of statuses (>10). You can see that the dropdown scrollbar goes down outside of the iFrame.

h3. Expected Results

All statuses are visible
h3. Actual Results

Only certain statuses are visible because the drop-down is too small
h3. Notes
h3. Workaround

The only workaround is to tick the box for *all* statuses. However, this defies the purpose of selectiveness.
fields.summary: Transition dropdown is cropped in Jira Cloud for Slack integration app
